solution_line_template: She needs to fill a total of {num_balloons} * {gallons_per_balloon} = <<{num_balloons}*{gallons_per_balloon}={total_gallons_needed}>>{total_gallons_needed} gallons of air.
In the first {first_time} minutes, she fills {first_rate} * {first_time} = <<{first_rate}*{first_time}={gallons_filled_first_period}>>{gallons_filled_first_period} gallons of air.

For the next {second_time} minutes, she fills {first_rate} / {half_rate_divisor} * {second_time} = <<{first_rate}/{half_rate_divisor}*{second_time}={gallons_filled_second_period}>>{gallons_filled_second_period} gallons of air.

That leaves her with {total_gallons_needed} - {gallons_filled_first_period} - {gallons_filled_second_period} = <<{total_gallons_needed}-{gallons_filled_first_period}-{gallons_filled_second_period}={remaining_gallons}>>{remaining_gallons} gallons of air to fill.
It will take her {remaining_gallons} / {final_rate} = <<{remaining_gallons}/{final_rate}={time_for_rest}>>{time_for_rest} more minutes to fill the rest of the balloons.
The total time to fill all of the balloons is {first_time} + {second_time} + {time_for_rest} = <<{first_time}+{second_time}+{time_for_rest}={total_time}>>{total_time} minutes.
